homepage_h2:
daisyUI - це плагін Tailwind CSS, який вам сподобається!
Він надає корисні імена класів компонентів
щоб допомогти вам писати менше коду і швидше будувати.
In a Tailwind CSS project, you need to w: У Tailwind CSS проєкті, вам потрібно писати імена класів для кожного елементу. Тисячі назв класів лише для стилізації найпростіших елементів.
instead of writing<br /> <span class='te:
замість того, щоб писати
100 класів
For every element, every page, every pro:
Для кожного елемента, кожної сторінки, кожного проєкту,
знову і знову
It's descriptive, faster, cleaner and ea: Це описово, швидше, чистіше та легше в обслуговуванні.
Use Tailwind CSS but write fewer class n: Use Tailwind CSS but write fewer class names.
daisyUI adds class names to Tailwind CSS:
daisyUI додає низку класів до Tailwind CSS
для всіх поширених UI компонентів.
Такі як
This allows us to focus on important thi:
Це дозволяє нам зосередитися на важливих речах
замість того, щоб створювати основні елементи для кожного проєкту.
Write fewer class names<br />Use compone:
Пишіть менше імен класів
Використовуйте імена класів компонентів
Змінюйте їх за допомогою утиліт Tailwind CSS.
With daisyUI, you write 88% fewer class:
З daisyUI, ви пишете на 88% меньше класів
А ваш розмір HTML буде приблизно на 79% меншим.
daisyUI is built on top of Tailwind&nbsp: daisyUI створено на основі Tailwind CSS, тому ви можете налаштувати все за допомогою службових класів.
daisyUI is a plugin for Tailwind CSS. It: daisyUI — це плагін для Tailwind CSS. Він працює на всіх фреймворках JS і не потребує пакетного файлу JS.
Install daisyUI as a dev dependency and: Інсталюйте daisyUI як dev залежність та використовуйте назви класів так само, як будь-які інші CSS класи Tailwind.
Your website should be unique. Create a: Ваш сайт має бути унікальним. Створіть власну тему за допомогою генератора тем daisyUI. Кольори, які ви виберете, будуть застосовані до всіх компонентів daisyUI.
Mix and match daisyUI class names to cre: Комбінуйте імена класів daisyUI для створення унікальних веб-сторінок.
daisyUI is the most popular<br />compone:
daisyUI найпопулярніша
бібліотека компонентів для Tailwind CSS
Also, using semantic color names makes t: Also, using semantic color names makes theming easier. You wouldn't have to define dark-mode colors for every single element and you wouldn't be limited to only light/dark themes. you can have multiple themes available and each theme is just a few lines of CSS variables.
Accordion is used for showing and hiding: Accordion is used for showing and hiding content but only one item can stay open at a time.
All radio inputs with the same name work: All radio inputs with the same name work together and only one of them can be open at a time. If you have more than one set of accordion items on a page, use different names for the radio inputs on each set.
Alert informs users about important even: Alert informs users about important events.
Avatars are used to show a thumbnail rep: Avatars are used to show a thumbnail representation of an individual or business in the interface.
Badges are used to inform the user of th: Badges are used to inform the user of the status of specific data.
Breadcrumbs helps users to navigate thro: Breadcrumbs helps users to navigate through the website.
Buttons allow the user to take actions o: Buttons allow the user to take actions or make choices.
Cards are used to group and display cont: Cards are used to group and display content in a way that is easily readable.
Carousel show images or content in a scr: Carousel show images or content in a scrollable area.
Chat bubbles are used to show one line o: Chat bubbles are used to show one line of conversation and all its data, including the author image, author name, time, etc.
Checkboxes are used to select or deselec: Checkboxes are used to select or deselect a value.
Collapse is used for showing and hiding: Collapse is used for showing and hiding content.
Diff component shows a side-by-side comp: Diff component shows a side-by-side comparison of two items.
Divider will be used to separate content: Divider will be used to separate content vertically or horizontally.
Drawer is a grid layout that can show/hi: Drawer is a grid layout that can show/hide a sidebar on the left or right side of the page.
Dropdown can open a menu or any other el: Dropdown can open a menu or any other element when the button is clicked.
File Input is a an input field for uploa: File Input is a an input field for uploading files.
Footer can contain logo, copyright notic: Footer can contain logo, copyright notice, and links to other pages.
Hero is a component for displaying a lar: Hero is a component for displaying a large box or image with a title and description.
Indicators are used to place an element: Indicators are used to place an element on the corner of another element.
Text Input is a simple input field.
Kbd is used to display keyboard shortcut: Kbd is used to display keyboard shortcuts.
Link adds the missing underline style to: Link adds the missing underline style to links.
Loading shows an animation to indicate t: Loading shows an animation to indicate that something is loading.
Mask crops the content of the element to: Mask crops the content of the element to common shapes.
Menu is used to display a list of links: Menu is used to display a list of links vertically or horizontally.
Browser mockup shows a box that looks li: Browser mockup shows a box that looks like a browser window.
Code mockup is used to show a block of c: Code mockup is used to show a block of code in a box that looks like a code editor.
Phone mockup shows a mockup of an iPhone: Phone mockup shows a mockup of an iPhone.
Window mockup shows a box that looks lik: Window mockup shows a box that looks like an operating system window.
Modal is used to show a dialog or a box: Modal is used to show a dialog or a box when you click a button.
Navbar is used to show a navigation bar: Navbar is used to show a navigation bar on the top of the page.
Pagination is a group of buttons that al: Pagination is a group of buttons that allow the user to navigate between a set of related content.
Progress bar can be used to show the pro: Progress bar can be used to show the progress of a task or to show the passing of time.
Radial progress can be used to show the: Radial progress can be used to show the progress of a task or to show the passing of time.
Radio buttons allow the user to select o: Radio buttons allow the user to select one option from a set.
Range slider is used to select a value b: Range slider is used to select a value by sliding a handle.
Rating is a set of radio buttons that al: Rating is a set of radio buttons that allow the user to rate something.
Select is used to pick a value from a li: Select is used to pick a value from a list of options.
Skeleton is a component that can be used: Skeleton is a component that can be used to show a loading state of a component.
Stack visually puts elements on top of e: Stack visually puts elements on top of each other.
Steps can be used to show a list of step: Steps can be used to show a list of steps in a process.
Swap allows you to toggle the visibility: Swap allows you to toggle the visibility of two elements using a checkbox or a class name.
Tabs can be used to show a list of links: Tabs can be used to show a list of links in a tabbed format.
Table can be used to show a list of data: Table can be used to show a list of data in a table format.
Textarea allows users to enter text in m: Textarea allows users to enter text in multiple lines.
If a checked checkbox input or a checked: If a checked checkbox input or a checked radio input with theme-controller class exists in the page, The page will have the same theme as that input's value.
Timeline component shows a list of event: Timeline component shows a list of events in chronological order.
Toast is a wrapper to stack elements, po: Toast is a wrapper to stack elements, positioned on the corner of page.
Toggle is a checkbox that is styled to l: Toggle is a checkbox that is styled to look like a switch button.
Tooltip can be used to show a message wh: Tooltip can be used to show a message when hovering over an element.
You don't need to install anything.
Just add one of these to the <code>head<: Just add one of these to the head tag of your HTML
How to use daisyUI from a CDN?: How to use daisyUI from a CDN?
daisyUI is fully themeable and colorable: daisyUI is fully themeable and colorable,
So instead of using constant color utili: So instead of using constant color utility classes like:
It's suggested to use semantic color uti: It's suggested to use semantic color utility classes like:
Each color name contains CSS variables a: Each color name contains CSS variables and each daisyUI theme applies color values to the utility classes when it is applied.
Semantic color names make more sense bec: Semantic color names make more sense because when we design interfaces, we don't just use any random color. We define a specific color palette with names like primary, secondary, etc. and we only use those specific colors in our interfaces.
List of all daisyUI color names: List of all daisyUI color names
You can use these color names in your th: You can use these color names in your theme or in utility classes.
Some daisyUI components come with modifi: Some daisyUI components come with modifier class names and that modifier class name will apply a color.
You can also use color names in utility: You can also use color names in utility classes just like Tailwind's original color names.
These are utility classes that can be us: These are utility classes that can be used with a color name:
How to change the default configuration: How to change the default configuration of daisyUI?
daisyUI components come with many varian: daisyUI components come with many variants necessary for design systems and you won't usually need to customize anything.
But you can still customize components i: But you can still customize components in many ways.
Let's say, you want to customize this bu: Let's say, you want to customize this button:
You can use daisyUI utility classes:: You can use daisyUI utility classes:
You can use Tailwind's utility classes:: You can use Tailwind's utility classes:
You can customize components on your CSS: You can customize components on your CSS file, using Tailwind's @apply directive:
Install daisyUI as a Tailwind CSS plugin: Встановіть daisyUI як Tailwind CSS плагін
You need <a target=_blank' href='https:/: You need Node.js and Tailwind CSS installed.
How to install daisyUI as a Tailwind CSS: Як установити daisyUI як Tailwind CSS плагін?
See example setup of daisyUI and Tailwin: See example setup of daisyUI and Tailwind CSS on different frameworks and build tools.
How to use layouts and typography in dai: How to use layouts and typography in daisyUI
Layout, sizing, grids, spacing, etc. all: Layout, sizing, grids, spacing, etc. all will be handled by Tailwind CSS's utility classes.
How to use a theme only for a section of: How to use a theme only for a section of a page?
Add <code>data-theme='THEME_NAME'</code>: Add data-theme='THEME_NAME' to any element and everything inside will have your theme.
You can nest themes and there is no limi: You can nest themes and there is no limit!
You can force a section of your HTML to: You can force a section of your HTML to only use a specific theme.
How to add a new custom theme?: How to add a new custom theme?
How to customize an existing theme?: How to customize an existing theme?
How to add custom styles for a specific: How to add custom styles for a specific theme?
You can write custom style for your elem: You can write custom style for your elements only for a specific theme.
Add component classes to your HTML: Add component classes to your HTML
How to use daisyUI classes to style your: How to use daisyUI classes to style your page?
Once you <a href='/docs/install/'>instal: Once you installed daisyUI, you can use component classes like btn, card, etc.
So instead of making a button using only: So instead of making a button using only utility classes
You can just use a component class like: You can just use a component class like this
Then you can modify the component with d: Then you can modify the component with daisyUI additional utility classes
Or you can modify the component with Tai: Or you can modify the component with Tailwind CSS utility classes
All daisyUI colors can be used as utilit: All daisyUI colors can be used as utility classes. Just like any other Tailwind CSS color. For example you can use `primary` color with any of Tailwind CSS color utilities.
These CSS variables are being used inter: These CSS variables are being used internally for a specific component
To use a custom prefix, <a class='link': To use a custom prefix, add your prefix string to config
footer-tagline:
Безкоштовна бібліотека компонентів
Перш за все для CSS фреймворків
daisyUI adds a set of customizable color: daisyUI додає набір назв кольорів до CSS Tailwind, і ці нові кольори використовують змінні CSS для значень. Використовуючи назви кольорів daisyUI, ви отримуєте темний режим і навіть більше тем без додавання нової назви класу.
daisyUI welcomes contributions from deve: daisyUI вітає внески розробників з усього світу
If it's true, components will have color: If it's true, components will have colors and style so you won't need to design anything.
If it's false, components will have no c: If it's false, components will have no color and no visual style so you can design your own style on a basic skeleton.
If it's true, all themes will be include: If it's true, all themes will be included.
If it's false, only light and dark theme: If it's false, only light and dark themes will be available.
If it's an array, only themes in the arr: If it's an array, only themes in the array will be included and the first theme will be the default theme.
If it's true, daisyUI shows logs in the: If it's true, daisyUI shows logs in the terminal while CSS is building.
Adds a prefix to class name for all dais: Adds a prefix to class name for all daisyUI classes (including component classes, modifier classes and responsive classes).
If you're using a second CSS library tha: If you're using a second CSS library that has similar class names, you can use this config to avoid conflicts.
daisyUI comes with a number of themes, w: daisyUI comes with a number of themes, which you can use with no extra effort.
Each theme defines a set of colors which: Each theme defines a set of colors which will be used on all daisyUI elements.
You can only include the themes you want: You can only include the themes you want in your project.
This will reduce the size of your CSS fi: This will reduce the size of your CSS file.
In the below example, I have the require: In the below example, I have the required colors. All other colors will be generated automatically (Like the color of button when you focus on it or the color of text on a primary button).
There are a few optional CSS variables t: There are a few optional CSS variables that you can use in daisyUI themes to customize design decisions for each theme:
Custom CSS for a daisyUI theme: Custom CSS for a daisyUI theme
You can apply custom style to a daisyUI: You can apply custom style to a daisyUI themes using CSS:
Artboard provides fixed size container t: Artboard provides fixed size container to display a demo content on mobile size.
Bottom navigation bar allows navigation: Bottom navigation bar allows navigation between primary screens.
Button group shows buttons next to each: Button group shows buttons next to each other.
Countdown gives you a transition effect: Countdown gives you a transition effect of changing numbers.
Input group puts an input next to a text: Input group puts an input next to a text or a button.
Stat is used to show numbers and data in: Stat is used to show numbers and data in a box.
You can also define optional colors to h: You can also define optional colors to have more control on the color values (for example: the color of a button when it's focused on the color of the text on a button)
It handles everything and it's fully cus: It handles everything and it's fully customizable.
daisyUI adds some style to @tailwindcss/: daisyUI adds some style to @tailwindcss/typography so it will use the same theme as other elements.
Changes the style of a component: Changes the style of a component
Join is a container for grouping multipl: Join is a container for grouping multiple items, it can be used to group buttons, inputs, or any other element. Join applies border radius to the first and last item. Join can be used to create a horizontal or vertical list of items.
This button will have different sizes on: This button will have different sizes on different browser viewpoints
Modal that closes when clicked outside: Modal that closes when clicked outside
If you set max-width or the list gets la: If you set max-width or the list gets larger than the container it will scroll
to join the items together and handle bo: to join the items together and handle border radius automatically
This collapse works with focus. When div: This collapse works with focus. When div loses focus, it gets closed
This collapse works with checkbox instea: This collapse works with checkbox instead of focus. It needs to get clicked again to get closed.
Use Tailwind CSS `group` and `group-focu: Use Tailwind CSS `group` and `group-focus` utilities to apply style when parent div is focused
Use Tailwind CSS `peer` and `peer-checke: Use Tailwind CSS `peer` and `peer-checked` utilities to apply style when sibling checkbox is checked
opens on click using ID.showModal() meth: opens on click using ID.showModal() method. can be closed using ID.close() method
there is a second form with 'modal-backd: there is a second form with 'modal-backdrop' class and it covers the screen so we can close the modal when clicked outside
You can use any w-* and max-w-* utility: You can use any w-* and max-w-* utility class to customize the width
Modal works with a hidden checkbox and l: Modal works with a hidden checkbox and labels can toggle the checkbox so we can use another label tag with 'modal-backdrop' class that covers the screen so we can close the modal when clicked outside
Dialog modal with a close button at corn: Dialog modal with a close button at corner
Instead of working with click, it shows: Instead of working with click, it shows swap-on item if you add swap-active class name. You can add or remove swap-active class using JS
Install daisyUI as a Tailwind plugin: Install daisyUI as a Tailwind plugin
daisyUI adds a few base styles to your p: daisyUI adds a few base styles to your page.
daisyUI provides a few useful utility cl: daisyUI provides a few useful utility classes and CSS variables to help you use the library more effectively.
